definition[0]: someone who is travelling in a vehicle, plane, boat etc, but is not driving it or working on it
example[0]: Neither the driver nor the passengers were hurt.
example[1]: a crash involving a passenger train
example[2]: Rail passengers now face even longer delays.
definition[1]: someone in a group who does not do their share of the group’s work
example[3]: The company can’t afford to carry any passengers.
example[4]: The aeroplane was carrying over 500 passengers.
example[5]: More than 7.6m rail passengers travelled on the Eurostar rail service last year.
collocation[2]: passengers get on/off a bus/plane etc
example[6]: The bus stopped and half the passengers got off.
example[7]: The first three cars were reserved for passengers boarding in Queens.
example[8]: At least 1,000 passengers were stranded at the airport because of the storm.
example[9]: Rail passengers will have to pay more for their tickets next year.
example[10]: All airline passengers arriving at Heathrow must go through customs.
example[11]: Bus passengers are facing higher fares.
example[12]: A queue of foot passengers was waiting to get on the ferry.
example[13]: The driver of the passenger train was unable to stop in time.
example[14]: It was recently converted from a passenger plane to cargo use.
example[15]: It is the biggest passenger ship afloat.
example[16]: Business passengers wishing to relax in comfort before their flight can use the Business Wing Airport Lounge facilities at Glasgow Airport.
